eu.toolchain.concurrent

Interface Async

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CoreAsync

    public interface Async
    The async framework.

    This type is intended to be passed around in your application, preferably through dependency injection.

    It makes the contract between the framework and your application decoupled, which has several benefits for your application's code (see README for details).

    • Method Detail

      • completable

        <T> Completable<T> completable()
        Build a new resolvable completable.

        The completable is returned in a running state, and can be completed, failed, or cancelled. See documentation for Stage for details on the various states.

        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the completable.
        Returns:
        a new completable

      • completed

        Stage<Void> completed()
        Returns an already completed void completable.

        The completable is immediately completed with a null value.

        Returns:
        a new already completed completable
        See Also:
        completed(Object)

        Type Parameters:

        U - target type the collected stages are being transformed into
        Parameters:

        collector - the collector
        Returns:

      • streamCollect

        <T,U> Stage<U> streamCollect(Collection<? extends Stage<? extends T>> stages,
                             Consumer<? super T> consumer,
                             Supplier<? extends U> supplier)
        Build a new stage that is the result of applying a computation on a collection of stages.

        This is similar to collect(Collection, Function), but uses abstractions which operates on the stream of results as they arrive.

        This allows the implementor to reduce memory usage for certain operations since all results does not have to be collected.

        If the returned stage ends up in a non-completed state, this will be forwarded to the given list of stages as well.

        Type Parameters:
        T - source type of the collected stages
        U - target type of the collector
        Parameters:
        stages - the collection of stages
        consumer - value consumer
        supplier - result supplier
        Returns:
        a stage bound to the collected value of the collector

      • collectAndDiscard

        default Stage<Void> collectAndDiscard(Stream<? extends Stage<?>> stream)
        Collect the results from a stream of stages, then discard them.
        Parameters:
        stream - stream to collect results from
        Returns:
        a new completable

      • collectAndDiscard

        Stage<Void> collectAndDiscard(Collection<? extends Stage<?>> stages)
        Collect the results from a collection of stages, then discard them.

        Signals like cancellations and failures will be communicated in a similar fashion to streamCollect(Collection, Consumer, Supplier).

        Parameters:
        stages - collection to collect
        Returns:
        a new completable

      • eventuallyCollect

        <T,U> Stage<U> eventuallyCollect(Collection<? extends Callable<? extends Stage<? extends T>>> callables,
                                 Consumer<? super T> consumer,
                                 Supplier<? extends U> supplier,
                                 int parallelism)
        Collect the result from a collection of operations that are lazily created.

        Async will be created using the given callables, but will only create as many pending stages to be less than or equal to the given parallelism setting.

        If a single completable is cancelled, or failed, all the other will be as well.

        This method is intended to be used for rate-limiting requests that could potentially be difficult to stop cleanly, or would use too many parallel resources.

        A common example is when querying a database for many distinct things, you typically want to initiating all requests at the same time.

        Type Parameters:
        T - source type of the collected stages
        U - target type the collected stages are being transformed into
        Parameters:
        callables - the collection of operations
        consumer - value consumer
        supplier - result supplier
        parallelism - number of stages that are allowed to be pending at the same time
        Returns:
        a new completable that is completed when all operations are completed

      • call

        <T> Stage<T> call(Callable<? extends T> callable)
        Call the given callable on the default executor and track the result using a completable.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the operation
        Parameters:
        callable - operation to call
        Returns:
        a new completable
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no default executor service is configured
        See Also:
        call(Callable, ExecutorService)

      • retryUntilCompleted

        <T> Stage<RetryResult<T>> retryUntilCompleted(Callable<? extends Stage<T>> callable,
                                              RetryPolicy policy)
        Retry the given action until it has been completed, or the provided RetryPolicy expire.
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        policy - retry policy to use
        Returns:

        See Also:
